intro: Odontonema geminatum, commonly known as the twinleaf strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble a crown of flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its blooming period occurs during the rainy season, producing clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
